Detection of network traffic crossing ne.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log collected near network boundary devices. Define expected and prohibited traffic patterns based on documented network security policies. Identify and alert on connections traversing boundaries (between defined internal/external or segmented IP ranges) that match prohibited protocols, ports, or source/destination pairs. Use frequency analysis to identify rare or anomalous traffic types crossing boundaries.

Unauthorized or anomalous configuration.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for unusual connections to network device management interfaces (e.g., SSH, HTTPS management ports) from unexpected sources. Analyze Windows Event ID 4663 (Object Access auditing) on management servers or jump boxes configured to audit access to network device configuration files. Look for access patterns inconsistent with authorized administrators (e.g., access at unusual times, from unexpected hosts). Correlate network traffic to management interfaces with host-based events.
